name: Dirt Around Quizzyland | Thematic Fun | 20 Questions

questions.text: ANIMALS: What animal primarily lives in the dirt and eats dirt as well?
questions.explanation:
Earthworm.

	The earth worm mainly lives in the dirt, although some species rise to the surface to mate or eat other organic matter. The earth worm's movement around the dirt aerates and mixes the soil, and even creates nutrients good for many plants. This makes the earth worm great for farmers and gardeners. Most worms will also take organic material like dead leaves and manure, and bring it down in the ground either to plug their burrow or to use as food.They usually tear the material to shreds, and they partially digest it. When it leaves the worm's body, it will mix with intestinal secretions, thus fertilizing the soil.By aerating the soil, the earthworm keeps open passages for water to drain into the soil for plants to pick up, and also makes easy passages for oxygen to travel.

questions.text:
BRAIN TEASERS: OK, I will give you some synonyms of words and you must tell me what the real words are. For example, obese feline becomes fat cat.

What is "a movie about household filth?"
questions.correct: film of dust & a film of dust & a film of dirt & film of dirt
questions.explanation:
film of dust & a film of dust & a film of dirt & film of dirt.

	A movie is a film. This is the first word. Household filth is dust, the second word. Put this together to make a film of dust. When you see a film of dust it is usually because there is dust in the air and it settles on the surface. Dust will land everywhere, and it is always in the air, so you can never get rid of it completely.  Dust can be described as any solid material smaller than 500 micrometers.  Dust in the home is mainly made up of dead skin cells. It is estimated that the entire outer layer of skin is shed every one or two days. In order to shed an entire layer so quickly, scientists have estimated that you lose skin flakes at a rate of 7 million cells a minute. That is a lot of skin flakes!

questions.text: CELEBRITIES: Who is the host of "Dirty Jobs"?
questions.explanation:
Mike Rowe.

	Mike Rowe is always put in dirty and dangerous situations. The show is about people doing dirty jobs to make the world a better place, and more livable.  Mike Rowe assists them, and tries to see what it is like to do that dirty job. He has done many unpleasant jobs, including mining, caving (not to be confused with spelunking), geoduck harvesting any many other dirty, dirty jobs. His show is shown on Discovery Channel. He also frequently talks about his camera crew, mainly Barsky, and tells us what went wrong with them. One time Barsky and the crew fell over in a boat and they lost all of their expensive equipment. Mike Rowe used to be an opera singer, and now his show is watched by mostly women who want to see him, not what he is doing. Three pilot episodes were shown in November of 2003. The pilot episodes were so popular, the show returned on July 26, 2005 as an actual television series.

questions.text: ENTERTAINMENT: Which of the following comic book super villains is made up of a lot of dirt?
questions.explanation:
Sandman.

	The Sandman is an enemy of Spider-Man's, and his body has been made into sand, but he has complete control of the sand. He was first introduced in 1963 in "The Amazing Spider-Man #4". He was played by Thomas Hayden Church in the 2007 movie, "Spider-Man 3". The Sandman started his life of crime after he beat up his football coach for kicking him off the team after throwing a game.He was put in and out of jail often, and one day he decided to escape. He escaped to a nuclear testing site in Savannah, Georgia. On this testing site some sand had been irradiated by an experimental reactor. The Sandman came in contact with this sand, thus turning him into sand.At one point in time he found that the sand began turning into glass, but he was able to reverse the effect.

questions.text: FOR CHILDREN: On this show, someone said "I'm a dirty boy", after falling in the mud when Gary didn't want to take a bath. What television show is this?
questions.explanation:
SpongeBob SquarePants.

	This episode was called "Gary Takes a Bath". Spongebob kept leaning over a tree to tell Gary not to touch that mud puddle. Gary had previously taken the ladder away so Spongebob couldn't get down. Finally, Spongebob came flying off the tree right into the mud. He ended up being the one taking the bath. The episode aired as the 33rd episode on March 7, 2001. It was paired with "Shanghaied" to fill the whole 30 minute time slot.

questions.text: GENERAL: Dirt and dust are everywhere, but can you tell me - out of these options - where in your house will collect the most dust and dirt?
options: Under the cushions of your sofa
questions.explanation:
Your dryer.

	Although you will collect a lot of dust under your sofa and sofa cushions after a few years, you will always have the most dust or dirt in and around your dryer. When you run a load through the dryer, a large amount of dust and lint gathers on the lint catcher, and even more of it throughout the whole dryer.  Lint is made from linen and cotton shards, as well as trace amounts of dust and dirt that the washing machine didn't quite remove.

questions.text: GEOGRAPHY: Here in the Sahara you will see nothing but dirt. Which of these countries is NOT part of the Sahara?
questions.explanation:
Namibia.

	Namibia is nowhere near the Sahara. While the Sahara is in the northern half of Africa, Namibia is clear at the Southern part of the continent. Libya and Tunisia are on the Northern part, bordering the Mediterranean Sea. Chad is located in the center of northern Africa.

questions.text: HISTORY: In 1989, what soil became Florida's state dirt?
questions.explanation:
Myakka.

	Florida adopted Myakka as its official state soil in 1989. Myakka is a Native American word meaning 'big waters'. Myakka came from marine deposits, and is a key part of Florida's flatwoods, so it is a flatwoods soil. It is found in tidal areas, depressions, and barrier islands. Bama became Alabama's state soil in 1997. Hilo is Hawaii's state soil and Tifton is Georgia's state soil.

questions.text: HOBBIES: What kind of dessert is called "Dirt and Worms?"
questions.explanation:
Pudding.

	"Dirt and Worms" is a chocolate pudding. It is called dirt and worms because it is covered in Oreo crumbs, which look like dirt. It is also topped with gummy worms. This dessert is most popular for children, but many people, young and old, enjoy eating "Dirt and Worms". "Dirt and Worms" can be made in several different ways. You can go 'all out' and add many different things, even putting the pudding in a pot, or you can make it simple with Oreo crumbs on top of pudding with worms.  This can also be called flower pot cake or dirt cake.

questions.text: HUMANITIES: A television series competition searched for the lead roles of which Broadway musical-turned-movie to make a Broadway musical (or, at least, a revival of the original Broadway musical)?
questions.explanation:
Grease.

	The television series was called "Grease: You're the One That I Want!" (2007). The show was looking for the lead roles, Danny and Sandy. The winners of the competition were Max Crumm and Laura Osnes. Max Crumm got the role of Danny Zuko and Laura Osnes got the role of Sandy Dumbrowski.

questions.text: LITERATURE: In what book is Jakkin usually covered in dirt while playing with and training his dragon?
questions.explanation:
Dragon's Blood.

	In "Dragon's Blood", Jakkin is a bonder who has always dreamed about having a secret dragon. He steals one to train it so he can get out of his bondage and become a master. "Dragon's Blood" is written by Jane Yolen. "Dragon's Blood" was written in 1982, and is part of the "Pit Dragon Trilogy". It is the first book in the trilogy, followed by "Heart's Blood" and "A Sending of the Dragons".

questions.text: MOVIES: In what movie do we see a young slave and racer who lives on a remote planet with two suns? On this planet you can see nothing but sand and dust for miles. The sandstorms can become quite dangerous.
questions.correct: Star Wars I: The Phantom Menace
options: Star Wars III: Revenge of the Sith
Star Wars IV: A New Hope
questions.explanation:
Star Wars I: The Phantom Menace.

	Anakin is a young pod racer who is also a slave. He lives on Tatooine. Sandstorms are very dangerous in Tatooine. Tatooine is also the home of Jabba the Hutt, the Pit of Carkoon, and Sandpeople. The Sandpeople are always seen in groups, riding banthas. "The Phantom Menace" was written by George Lucas and was released in 1999. It was the fourth movie made in the "Star Wars" saga, but it is the first movie chronologically.

questions.text: MUSIC: According to a popular country song, where might there be dust?
questions.explanation:
On the bottle.

	David Lee Murphy wrote and sang this song, entitled "Dust on the Bottle". This bottle was a bottle of wine. Murphy mentioned that you shouldn't be fooled by this dust, because what's inside will get sweeter with time.His song hit number one on the US Hot Country list, the only of his songs to do so. The song featured on the album "Out With a Bang" in 1995."There might be a little dust on the bottle,But don't let it fool ya 'bout what's inside.Might me a little dust on the bottle,But it's one of those things that gets sweeter with time."

questions.text: PEOPLE: Which American actor has been in several movies, including "Tootsie", "Midnight Cowboy" and the "The Graduate"?
questions.explanation:
Dustin Hoffman & Hoffman.

	Dustin Hoffman starts with DUST, get it? Dustin was born August 8th, 1937 in Los Angeles, California. He has been in over sixty movies, including several voice-overs in 2008.

questions.text: RELIGION: Which man was given the breath of life from God after being made from dust?
questions.explanation:
Adam.

	"From dust you are and to dust you will return." (Genesis 3:19 ["New World Translation of the Holy Scriptures"]) Adam was the very first man in the Bible. He noticed all the animals having mates, though, in the Garden of Eden, and wanted one of his own. So God put him in a deep sleep and took his rib out and made the woman out of his rib. Her name was Eve. The full account can be found in Genesis.

questions.text: SCI/TECH: For science and technology, we move on to earth science. What weather condition involves wind that blows dust everywhere and creates a funnel cloud?
questions.explanation:
Tornado.

	Tornadoes can destroy virtually everything in their path, just like a hurricane. Hurricanes, however, are large funnels of water that create heavy rain and strong winds. No dust there. Blizzards are a mixture of wind and snow, making it very hard to see. Thunderstorms, the most common of the choices, are a mix of thunder, lightning, and rain. Sometimes hail is involved too.

questions.text: SPORTS: In what sport do people slide on the dirt to hit the plate before being tagged out?
questions.explanation:
Baseball.

	In baseball, you must touch the plates or you get an out. If you make it through all bases to the home you get a home run. Most baseball players become very dirty, thus it was put in this quiz.

questions.text: TELEVISION: On the television show "Survivor: China," one person was probably always covered in dirt on the job. Who was this?
questions.explanation:
James.

	James was a gravedigger, so he was always in a hole. Denise was a lunch lady, so she didn't get that dirty. Todd was a flight attendant and Jean Robert was a professional poker player, neither of which get you dirty. The idea for "Survivor" was suggested by Charlie Parsons in 1992, but it didn't become a hit until 1997 with its debut in Sweden. Many people didn't like the idea of "Survivor", so they edited parts not suitable for TV. "Survivor: China" was the 15th season of "Survivor".

questions.text: VIDEO GAMES: In what video game do you befriend a mole who constantly digs holes in the dirt, spending days in there, because of his fear of the fresh air?
questions.explanation:
Spyro: A Hero's Tail.

	This Mole's name is Blink. He is related to the Professor, his uncle. You don't meet Blink until "A Hero's Tail", and he doesn't show up on "An Eternal Night". The game was introduced in 2004.

questions.text: WORLD: Which of these magazines might actually ask you to really get into the dirt to pull the weeds out of your flowerbeds?
questions.explanation:
Better Homes and Gardens.

	"Better Homes and Gardens" is mainly about the home and garden. It will give you tips and tricks and some other ideas about the home an its surrounding landscape. The other three have nothing to do with gardening. Edwin Meredith founded the magazine in 1922.
